intro: Clermontia bicolorata, commonly known as the Kauai ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen, lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as montane rainforests. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are dispersed by birds. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
